dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, looking at Tesla's latest earnings, it's pretty wild, right? Their shares just shot up like 11% after hours.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, looking at Tesla's latest earnings, it's pretty wild, right? Their shares just shot up like eleven percent after hours.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The shares spiked following the results announcement, rising 11% to $644.99 in after-hours Nasdaq trading.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no, totally. I mean, they reported a net income of $105 million on like, $7.38 billion in revenue. And that *crushed* expectations, didn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no, totally. I mean, they reported a net income of one hundred five million dollars on like, seven point three eight billion dollars in revenue. And that crushed expectations, didn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Silicon Valley-based carmaker reported net income for the quarter of $105 million on revenue of $7.38 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Analysts were expecting $1.72 a share and they hit $2.14. Plus, a big chunk of that, um, came from those regulatory credits, right? Like $133 million in "free money" as some call it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Analysts were expecting one point seven two dollars a share and they hit two point one four dollars. Plus, a big chunk of that, um, came from those regulatory credits, right? Like one hundred thirty three million dollars in free money as some call it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Adjusted EPS was $2.14. That topped expectations of $1.72 a share and revenue of $7.02 billion, according to a Reuters survey of equity analysts. Tesla once again got a boost from sales of zero-emission and other regulatory credits to other automakers in the quarter, booking $133 million of the free money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that definitely helped. But Elon Musk, I mean, he called last year a "turning point" for Tesla. They really ramped up Model 3 demand and got back to GAAP profitability in the second half.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that definitely helped. But Elon Musk, I mean, he called last year a turning point for Tesla. They really ramped up Model three demand and got back to G A A P profitability in the second half.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last year was a turning point for Tesla, Musk said in a letter to investors. We demonstrated strong organic demand for Model 3, returned to GAAP profitability in 2H19 and generated $1.1B of free cash flow for the year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, you know, after years of, like, wobbly finances and just wild stock swings, it feels like they're finally showing signs of more stable operations. This idea of a "new narrative" for Tesla.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, you know, after years of, like, wobbly finances and just wild stock swings, it feels like they're finally showing signs of more stable operations. This idea of a new narrative for Tesla.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After years of wobbly finances, wild stock price swings, unfulfilled promises and Musks self-inflicted wounds from fights with securities regulators and critics, the company may be showing signs of more stable operations. ... This quarter may be seen as the moment a new genre of tech investors were waiting to perceive Tesla through a new narrative: as a profitable and cash generative tech company...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Right? Adam Jonas from Morgan Stanley, he said this quarter might be when investors finally see them as a genuinely profitable, cash-generative tech company. And they're targeting half a million deliveries this year, which is huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Adam Jonas from Morgan Stanley, he said this quarter might be when investors finally see them as a genuinely profitable, cash-generative tech company. And they're targeting half a million deliveries this year, which is huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This quarter may be seen as the moment a new genre of tech investors were waiting to perceive Tesla through a new narrative: as a profitable and cash generative tech company with a reasonably-sized market cap in the same discussion as the mega-tech platform names, Morgan Stanley equity analyst Adam Jonas said in a research note. Tesla aims to deliver more than 500,000 vehicles this year, up from 367,500 in 2019...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the Model Y production started early, which is a good sign. The Shanghai plant is humming along. But then, like, you dig a bit deeper into the Berlin plant, and there's, uh, some local opposition brewing. Forest clearing, water usage...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the Model Y production started early, which is a good sign. The Shanghai plant is humming along. But then, like, you dig a bit deeper into the Berlin plant, and there's, uh, some local opposition brewing. Forest clearing, water usage...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a surprise announcement, it said production of Model Y crossovers started this month at the Fremont, California, plant, earlier than initially scheduled. Meanwhile, Teslas Shanghai plant that opened in record time in January is running as expected. ... That remains to be seen, owing to local German opposition to Teslas plans to cut down a portion of existing forest and concerns about how much water the plant will use.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. But on the Model Y, Jessica Caldwell from Edmunds made a good point: it's hitting a sweet spot in the EV crossover market. It's got that prestigious brand but, like, a much lower cost than other luxury options.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. But on the Model Y, Jessica Caldwell from Edmunds made a good point: it's hitting a sweet spot in the E V crossover market. It's got that prestigious brand but, like, a much lower cost than other luxury options.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla got a bit lucky in that the market evolved around them: unplanned, the Model Y might slide right in the sweet spot for the EV crossover market, said Jessica Caldwell, executive director of industry insights at Edmunds. It has a more prestigious brand than the mainstream hybrid nameplates but comes at a significantly less cost than the rest of the luxury competition.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So that's all good, but let's not forget the bigger picture: for the *full year*, Tesla actually reported an $862 million loss. I mean, after a decade, they still haven't posted an annual profit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So that's all good, but let's not forget the bigger picture: for the full year, Tesla actually reported an eight hundred sixty two million dollar loss. I mean, after a decade, they still haven't posted an annual profit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Teslas full-year loss was $862 million on record revenue of $26 billion. A decade after its initial public offering its never posted an annual profit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's the kicker, isn't it? Garrett Nelson, an analyst with a "Sell" rating, is still pretty cautious. He's worried about the China ramp-up and, like, rising EV competition from other automakers who still get federal tax credits.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's the kicker, isn't it? Garrett Nelson, an analyst with a Sell rating, is still pretty cautious. He's worried about the China ramp-up and, like, rising E V competition from other automakers who still get federal tax credits.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amid the rosy numbers, CFRA equity analyst Garrett Nelson, who has a Sell rating on Tesla, thinks there are still reasons for caution. We continue to see significant risks related to the China factory ramp-up, as well as rising EV competition from automakers still eligible for the full federal tax credit in the U.S., Nelson said in a research note.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, they didn't really give details on capital expenditure for that new German factory, which is a bit concerning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, they didn't really give details on capital expenditure for that new German factory, which is a bit concerning.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: TSLA also did not provide detail regarding capex related to its new factory in Germany.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, a mixed bag, then? A lot to celebrate, but still some big question marks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, a mixed bag, then? A lot to celebrate, but still some big question marks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It's never boring with Tesla.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It's never boring with Tesla.
